intro: Windmannia sundana, commonly known as the Sundanese windmannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Windmannia sundana typically thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
